text:
I’m thinking of playing with the Vision Transformer for a class project. It probably isn’t going to be very practical to try to do it in Julia, right?
Edit: it looks like there are pretrained ViT pytorch models, so maybe I can just use pytorch.jl to load them?

elements.text:
I’m thinking of playing with the Vision Transformer for a class project. It probably isn’t going to be very practical to try to do it in Julia, right?
Edit: it looks like there are pretrained ViT pytorch models, so maybe I can just use pytorch.jl to load them?

text: What is PyTorch.jl? If you mean Torch.jl, the purpose of that package is not to run models written in PyTorch from Julia. It is to run models written in Flux with libtorch which is the C++ library underlying PyTorch operations.

elements.text: What is PyTorch.jl? If you mean Torch.jl, the purpose of that package is not to run models written in PyTorch from Julia. It is to run models written in Flux with libtorch which is the C++ library underlying PyTorch operations.
